title: Allow arbitrary tunnel to be established before connection
author: andrewheberle
body_snippet:
This is about implementing something very similar to what was done in #1568 , however the feature would be to allow an arbitrary executable to be used to tunnel/connect to the endpoint.

The specific use case I am thinking of is to utilize Cloudflare Access/Argo Tunnel to connect to remote resources, but any application/service that creates a TCP tunnel could be used.

The way this works on the client side for Cloudflare at least, is you execute the `cloudflared` executable as follows (in th...

comments.snippet:
In lieu of any feedback on this, a more minor change would be to make the "SSH Tunnel" feature from #1568 more generic to allow selecting a SSH connection or a pre-configured "External Tool".

In the case of the "External Tool", there would need to be the option of referencing a new variable such as `%RANDOM_PORT%` for the local side of the tunnel that would correspond to the automatic "localhost:%RANDOM_PORT%" connection made via the tunnel.

As part of this, the "External Tool" would need ...
comments.author: andrewheberle

comments.snippet:
Hi,

This is a _generic_ implementation of the request #420.
I hope that at some point the developers will want to implement TUNNEL or PROXY support. ≡ƒñ₧

comments.snippet: See my comment on https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/182#issuecomment-968196049. I think a better configuration model will make a lot of things easier.
